item.title: Johnny Depp v Amber Heard: Most explosive moments so far in star-studded defamation trial
item.description: Over first two weeks of testimony, jury has heard from string of witnesses including couple’s former marriage counselor, their friends and Depp himself. Testimony has painted captivating and disturbing portrait of actors’ doomed marriage, laying bare violent fights, drug use and vicious words to each other. Here are some of most dramatic moments so far

media:content.media:text: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard at the Fairfax County Courthouse in Fairfax, Virginia on 25 April 2022 - (STEVE HELBER/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: Megan Sheets ,Gustaf Kilander,Graeme Massie,Oliver O'Connell and Clémence Michallon

item.title: What is Roe v Wade and did it get overturned?
item.description: Ruling enshrined women’s right to terminate a pregnancy

media:content.media:text: This April 26, 1989 file photo shows Norma McCorvey (L), known as "Jane Roe" in the 1973 landmark Roe vs Wade ruling that expanded abortion rights in the US, holding a pro-choice sign with attorney Gloria Allred (R) in front of the US Supreme Court building prior to attending arguments on an abortion case in Washington, DC. - (AFP)

item.title: Doctors share ‘horror show’ stories from before Roe v Wade – and their fears of what’s to come
item.description: Professor Carole Joffe interviewed 45 physicians and healthcare professionals almost 30 years ago about abortions before and after Roe v Wade. One of those doctors, along with the author, tells Sheila Flynn how the leaked Supreme Court memo may not foreshadow the medical ‘horror show’ seen pre-Roe – but disastrous other dilemmas will face both physicians and women

media:content.media:text: Curtis Boyd contributed to Carole Joffe’s 1995 book Doctors of Conscience, as fears rise again over the consequences of illegal abortions - (Getty/iStock/Reuters)
